discussion.content: correct
option A

Yes, Power BI Desktop is correct
Desktop is a complete data analysis and report creation tool that is used to connect to, transform, visualize, and analyze your data. It includes the Query Editor, in which you can connect to many different sources of data, and combine them (often called modeling) into a data model. Then you design a report based on that data model.
Power BI Desktop is correct. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/fundamentals/service-service-vs-desktop

Correct
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-upload-desktop-files

The answer is D. the Power BI service.

Explanation:

Power BI Service: This is the cloud-based service where you publish and share your Power BI reports and dashboards.

Power BI Desktop: This is where you create and edit your Power BI reports and data models.

Power BI Mobile App: This app allows you to view and interact with your Power BI reports and dashboards on your mobile devices.

In summary: The Power BI service is the central hub for publishing and sharing your Power BI content.

Reports can be shared with others directly or by publishing to the Power BI service. Sharing reports requires a Power BI Pro license.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//
Which type of Azure resource supports the serverless configuration of an Azure SQL database?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Serverless is a compute tier for single databases in Azure SQL Database that automatically scales compute based on workload demand and bills for the amount of compute used per second. The serverless compute tier also automatically pauses databases during inactive periods when only storage is billed and automatically resumes databases when activity returns.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer
option C

The type of Azure resource that supports the serverless configuration of an Azure SQL database is C. a single database in Azure SQL Database.

Azure SQL Database offers a serverless compute tier, which allows you to scale compute resources dynamically based on the workload demands. With the serverless configuration, you don't need to provision and manage a fixed amount of compute resources for your database. Instead, the compute resources are automatically scaled up or down based on the workload. This allows you to pay for the actual compute resources used on a per-second basis.

Selected Answer: C
Correct.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/database/serverless-tier-overview?view=azuresql&tabs=general-purpose

Selected Answer: C
similar to #99

choices.B: an Azure SQL Database elastic pool
choices.C: a single database in Azure SQL Database
choices.A: SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines

discussion.content: In an OLAP system, data is typically organized in a multidimensional model so.. 'Pre-aggregated' makes more sense
'Pre-aggregated

Online analytical processing (OLAP) systems are particularly suitable for analytical workloads because data is: pre-aggregated.

OLAP systems are designed to handle complex analytical queries and provide fast query response times. They achieve this by pre-aggregating data, meaning that calculations and aggregations are performed in advance and stored in a way that allows for efficient retrieval. This pre-aggregation reduces the need for complex calculations at query time and significantly improves the performance of analytical queries.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Azure Data Explorer: KQL (Kusto Query Language), which is a proprietary query language specifically designed for Azure Data Explorer. It is used to analyze and query large volumes of structured and unstructured data in real-time.

Azure Stream Analytics: SQL, which is a standard query language for relational databases. It is used to analyze and process high-velocity, real-time streaming data from various sources, such as IoT devices, social media platforms, and other real-time data streams.

Azure Synapse Analytics: SQL and Python. SQL is used to query and analyze structured data stored in Azure Synapse Analytics, while Python can be used for data preprocessing, machine learning, and other data science tasks.
what is the answer?

KQL: Azure Data Explorer
SQL: Azure Stream Analytics
SQL: Azure Synapse Analytics

Azure Stream Analytics uses a SQL query language that's augmented with powerful temporal constraints to analyze data in motion. You can create a Stream Analytics job using the Azure portal. You can also create jobs by using developer tools such as the following ones:
**VS Code
**Visual Studio
**Azure CLI
**Azure PowerShell
**Bicep
**ARM templates
**Terraform

KQL is associated with Azure Data Explorer.
Python is supported by Azure Stream Analytics.
SQL is used in Azure Synapse Analytics.
1_ KQL (Kusto Query Language): ((What is about ))
KQL is specifically designed for querying and analyzing data in Azure Data Explorer (ADX). ADX is a powerful service for ingesting, storing, and analyzing large volumes of data in real-time.
2_Python: ((Why?))
Python is a popular general-purpose programming language known for its readability and extensive libraries. It is widely used for data science, machine learning, and analytics.
Azure Stream Analytics supports Python as a language for writing custom user-defined functions (UDFs) and enriching real-time data streams.
3_SQL (Structured Query Language): ((Of curse))
SQL is the standard language for managing and querying relational databases. It is commonly used for data manipulation and reporting.
Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly known as SQL Data Warehouse) provides a powerful SQL-based analytics platform for both real-time and batch processing.

A. KQL
B. SQL
C. SQL
Was on exam 24/6/2023

comments.content: ans the correct answer for the last one?
where's the person with the 1000 score when you need him/her?

discussion.content: Azure Synapse offers a choice of several languages such as SQL, Python, .NET, Java, Scala and R, so not sure what's the answer for the last one...
